chunks.cleaned_english_translation: How he saw and drove away Satan. As the pain was beating at his vital organs and he was burning with the nearness of death, one day he saw the devil standing across from him and said, "What place is this for your wickedness, most evil Satan? Yet you were also the shameless attacker at the end of the blessed Martin's life. Surely, if you show no respect for us who do not deserve it, how did you not fear the holiness of such a great man?" Then he requested holy water and sprinkled it against the demon, and immediately the image of that horror disappeared.
chunks.original_latin:
(Quomodo Sathanam vidit et abegit) 
Dolore dehinc vitalia pulsante, cum fine iam propiore estuaret, quadam die vidit ex adverso diabolum consistere dixitque: "Quis nequitie tue, Sathan pessime, hic locus est? Sed tu beatissimi quoque Martini extremis improbus insidiator afuisti. Certe, si nos nullo predictos merito non revereris, quomodo tanti illius viri sanctitatem non extimuisti?" Tum postulata aqua benedicta contra demonem aspersit, et protinus illius horroris imago disparuit.
